author: Prajakta Bhanushali
text: We reached early, around 7:40 AM, and still had to wait for about 20 minutesâ€”guess the fame of this place is well-deserved! Even with the rush, the service was impressively fast. â€¦

author: Samiksha Toshniwal
text: The hype is real, but if you live somewhere around. I mean for a person living like ~20kms far, I would say better to visit someplace nearby. â€¦

author: Nyesha Sen
text: I had heard a lottt about this cafe and the Irani food you get here. I ended up visiting the place after the office and relished my time. â€¦

author: Shivani Kadam
text: Must try cheese omlete there.I know it sounds cheesy but that's the unique and most selling dish of vohuman cafe. ðŸ˜„ â€¦

author: Niraj Joshi
text: Their cheese omlette was exquisite to say the least. The crusty edges, the crunchy onion, the spicy masala and savoury cheese combination is just too good. Much better than sloppy cheese omelette from Irani cafe. Tea is classic irani chai. The bun butter wasn't good though. The bun seemed stale and brittle.

author: Ajit Thite
text:
Old charm is still there!!

We went during peak hours so we waited for some time but got the seat in 20 â€¦

author: Prajakta Bille
text:
I tried double cheese egg omelette and single egg burji pav along with tea and toast butter as bun maska was not available at that time.
I liked omelette and burji considering the price. But toast butter was â€¦

author: Kartikeya Pathak
text:
A Legendary Eatery: Vohuman Cafe Review

I recently had the pleasure of dining at Vohuman Cafe in Pune, an iconic â€¦

author: Sabyasachi Sanyal
text: One of the OG irani cafe of Pune, tea was amazing, so was the bun maska, although known for their cheese omelette, it was below average and avoid the malai.

author: Mayur Gade
text:
One of my favorite places for breakfast

Good - â€¦

author: Sachin Malthane
text: All the hype about the place is well deserved as the service and taste is top notch, tried double egg cheese omelette and tea with the perfect ambience. A must visit place with friends and family for breakfast

author: Abhishek Kadam
text: Theis place is very famous for their irani style cuisine. Service is a little slow. But the food is very delicious. Must try their double egg masala omelette, bun maska, special tea, egg bhurji.

author: Ramesh Choudhary
text:

author: Sarang Gurao
text: I went to this new location for the first time. It was not at all disappointing. Tea was 97% good and toast butter should have a little more butter.

author: Hunar Agrawal
text: Irani Cafe has a nice old-style feel. The bun maska was the best partâ€”soft, buttery, and tasty. The bill was Rs. 240, a bit expensive, but the taste and vibe made it worth it.
